docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 The House-approved Social Security bill was revised by the Senate Finance Committee today to provide more liberal benefit increases and a stiffer tax rise.

headline.main: SENATORS REVISE OLD-AGE BENEFITS; Panel Votes 15% Increase in Social Security Payment and Stiffens Tax Rise Senate Panel Votes Increase of 15% in Social Security Benefits

docs.abstract: Sen com, in revising HR-approved Soc Security bill, rejects Adm proposal to provide Medicare coverage for 1.5 million disabled workers under age 65
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 The House-approved Social Security bill was revised by the Senate Finance Committee today to provide more liberal benefit increases and a stiffer tax rise.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: HEALTH AND HOSPITAL INSURANCE AND RELATED GOVERNMENT AID
